00012 sub getLoc {
00013     my $lang = shift;
00014     loc_lang($lang);
00015     
00016     return \&loc;
00017 }
00018 
00019 # this is like [quant] but it doesn't write the number
00020 #  usage: [quant,_1,<singular>,<plural>,<optional zero>]
00021 
00022 sub plural {
00023     my($handle, $num, @forms) = @_;
00024 
00025     return "" if @forms == 0;  
00026     return $forms[2] if @forms > 2 and $num == 0; 
00027 
00028     # Normal case:
00029     return(  $handle->numerate($num, @forms) );
00030 }
00031 
00032 # this is like [quant] but it also has -1 case 
00033 #  usage: [negquant,_1,<neg case>,<singular>,<plural>,<optional zero>]
00034 
00035 sub negquant {
00036     my($handle, $num, @forms) = @_;
00037 
00038     return $num if @forms == 0;
00039 
00040     my $negcase = shift @forms;
00041     return $negcase if $num < 0;
00042 
00043     return $forms[2] if @forms > 2 and $num == 0; 
00044     return( $handle->numf($num) . ' ' . $handle->numerate($num, @forms) );
00045 }

00052 WeBWorK has encountered a software error while attempting to process this
00053 problem. It is likely that there is an error in the problem itself. If you are a
00054 student, report this error message to your professor to have it corrected. If
00055 you are a professor, please consult the error output below for more information.
00056 },
00057     '_LOGIN_MESSAGE' => q{
00058 If you check [_1] your 
00059 login information will be remembered by the browser 
00060 you are using, allowing you to visit WeBWorK pages 
00061 without typing your user name and password (until your 
00062 session expires). This feature is not safe for public 
00063 workstations, untrusted machines, and machines over 
00064 which you do not have direct control.

00066 '_HMWKSETS_EDITOR_DESCRIPTION' => q{ 
00067 This is the homework sets editor page where you can view and edit the homework sets that exist in
00068 this course and the problems that they contain. The top of the page contains forms which allow you
00069 to filter which sets to display in the table, sort the sets in a chosen order, edit homework sets,
00070 publish homework sets, import/export sets from/to an external file, score sets, or create/delete
00071 sets.  To use, please select the action you would like to perform, enter in the relevant information
00072 in the fields below, and hit the \"Take Action!\" button at the bottom of the form.  The bottom of
00073 the page contains a table displaying the sets and several pieces of relevant information.",
00074 },
00075 "_CLASSLIST_EDITOR_DESCRIPTION" => q{
00076 tr: This is the classlist editor page, where you can view and edit the records of all the students
00077 currently enrolled in this course.  The top of the page contains forms which allow you to filter
00078 which students to view, sort your students in a chosen order, edit student records, give new
00079 passwords to students, import/export student records from/to external files, or add/delete students.
00080  To use, please select the action you would like to perform, enter in the relevant information in
00081 the fields below, and hit the \"Take Action!\" button at the bottom of the form.  The bottom of the
00082 page contains a table containing the student usernames and their information.

00099 "_PROBLEM_SET_SUMMARY"   => q{This is a table showing the current Homework sets for this class.  The fields from left to right are: Edit Set Data, Edit Problems, Edit Assigned Users, Visibility to students, Reduced Credit Enabled, Date it was opened, Date it is due, and the Date during which the answers are posted.  The Edit Set Data field contains checkboxes for selection and a link to the set data editing page.  The cells in the Edit Problems fields contain links which take you to a page where you can edit the containing problems, and the cells in the edit assigned users field contains links which take you to a page where you can edit what students the set is assigned to.},
00100 
00101 "_USER_TABLE_SUMMARY"    => q{A table showing all the current users along with several fields of user information. The fields from left to right are: Login Name, Login Status, Assigned Sets, First Name, Last Name, Email Address, Student ID, Enrollment Status, Section, Recitation, Comments, and Permission Level.  Clicking on the links in the column headers will sort the table by the field it corresponds to. The Login Name fields contain checkboxes for selecting the user.  Clicking the link of the name itself will allow you to act as the selected user.  There will also be an image link following the name which will take you to a page where you can edit the selected user's information.  Clicking the emails will allow you to email the corresponding user.  Clicking the links in the entries in the assigned sets columns will take you to a page where you can view and reassign the sets for the selected user.},
